page.title: 07The Church
page.content: The church is called St Mary the Virgin and in the north aisle in the second window there is a fragment of old glass which is the head of the Blessed Virgin Mary. The piece of glass was found in the churchyard.There are also the remains of wall paintings,one is called the Doom painting ,it is thought that it was hidden during Puritan times.About the same time,on the eve of the Battle of Cropredy Bridge the lectern was hidden in the River Cherwell.The beak of the eagle is open and may have been used to collect "Peter's Pence",a tax then paid to Rome.The coins were removed from a slot in the tail.Above the organ there is a little window through which the priest could look into the church. The church was built at different times,some of it dates from 1050.There ae 6 bells in the tower,and 2 fonts.
